name: 狄雅南
objective:
1. Students will be able to solve dynamic mass and energy balances for chemical processes.
2. Students will be able to understand of the unit operations with a focus on liquid-liquid and fluid solid separation processes, membrane separation processes, and mechanical-physical separation processes.
3. Students will be able to calculate and design the unit operations in multicomponent systems.
schedule:
1st week : Introduction conservation momentum, mass, and energy
2nd week: Liquid-liquid and fluid-solid separation processes (Ch. 12)
3rd week : Batch adsorption and design of fixed-bed adsorption columns
4th week : Ion-exchange processes and liquid-liquid extraction
5th week : Liquid-solid leaching and crystallization
6th week : Membrane separation process (Ch. 13)
7th week : Liquid and gas separation by membranes 
8th week : RO membrane processes and short review for midterm exam
9th week : Midterm exam 
10th week: Applications membrane processes
11th week: Mechanical-physical separation processes (Ch. 14)
12th week: Solid-liquid separation
13th week: Settling and sedimentation in particular-fluid separation
14th week: Centrifugal separation process
15th week: Mechanical size reduction
16th week: Review and problems excercise
17th week: Review and problems excercise
18th week: Final exam
scorePolicy:

materials:
1.　　Geankoplis, C. J., Transport Processes and Unit Operations, 4th Ed., Allyn and Bacon 
        series in engineering, Boston, Massachusetts (1978).
2.　　McCabe, W. L., Smith, J. C., Harriott, P., Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering, 7th 
        Ed., McGraw-Hill.
